Mission: make it easy to buy local food, expand local food production; Env, Econ, Soc =
Sale Point: primarily consumers (online order); trying to begin wholesale

Mission: build a more healthy Community-based sustainable food system, expand food access to more people; making money is means to that end; prioritize social and environmental, and aim for financial support to meet those goals
Sale Point: typical (estimate): restaurants (10%), preschool-12 schools (45%), college/uni (25%); Vast majority of sales within same city, furthest are 30-min drive
Product Mix: Mainly: fruit, vegetable, dairy; some: flour, honey

Mission: get local foods into more (institutional) markets, being fair to growers and buyers/all members of coop; earn money to serve those goals; Soc-Env-Econ =
Sale Point: typically: primarily to schools, colleges/universities, and hospitals. In pandemic, those closed and they sold majority to CSAs (one large CSA plans to cont. 2021[Tomato Mountain (confirmed online)])
Farm scales: all small, though some aggregate produce together before selling to Fifth Season
Product Mix: Mainly: produce. Also: chopped/frozen veg, alternative burgers, syrup, honey, meat, dairy

Mission: build a local, regional economy and enhance financial viability for small farm; Econ > Soc or Env
Sale Point: schools 50%, colleges 13%, DtC 33%, grocers 2%, restaurants 1%. Largest sales points: 46% of sales in same county, 15% in bordering county, 14% two counties away
Farm scales: mostly small and medium, maybe 3 large
Product Mix: produce, dairy, eggs, meat, and many value-added

Mission: to feed S. IL; sustainable agriculture; Soc-Env-Econ =
Sale Point: preCOVID: 80% DtoC, 19% restaurant, 1% hospital. In COVID: 95% DtoC. S\erve five counties of IL
Product Mix: produce, dairy, eggs, meat, and many value-added

Mission: make it easy to eat local, build robust local economy in Chicago/midwest; Econ > Env or Soc
Farm scales: many large. As hub grows, working w/ larger farms; small farms only for specialty orders. Values working with small farms to help them grow bigger
Product Mix: full-spectrum - produce, dairy, eggs, meat, and many value-added
Infrastructure: warehouse, office, processing, trucks, online order, rental space, retail

Mission: [hazy, diff answers:] get healthy, local food to more people; help local farmers earn more; enhance market access of local food for farmers and consumers; Econ > Soc or Env
Sale Point: 80% DtoC, 15% restaurant, 5% grocer. Most sales in Fort Wayne, the remainder in surrounding counties (20 miles)

Mission: connnecting people to local food; Econ > Soc > Env
Farm scales: small and mid-size producers, but source much of their produce from another FH
Infrastructure: warehouse, office, processing, trucks, online order, rental space

Mission: support local farmers; earlier: econ & Env > Soc, now Econ, Env, and Soc more =
Farm scales: mostly mid- and large scale; "coddle" some small farms

Mission: make it easy to buy local food; help local farmers; unclear, but seems Soc and Env > Econ
Sale Point: hospitals 25%, CSA farms 25%, small grocer 21%, restaurants 10%, food processors 7%, colleges 7%, schools 5%
Product Mix: produce, dairy, eggs, meat, and many value-added
Infrastructure: warehouse, office, processing, trucks, online order

Mission: help local farmer access more markets, improve profits; Econ comes first, enables Soc and Env
Sale Point: large portion to large grocer (Roundy's, now Kroger, is largest customer); also institutional caterers
Farm scales: Mostly mid- and large scale; found it hard to serve small farms (transportation costs too high/volume)

Mission: help local farmers & spread nutritious local food year-round; Econ > Soc or Env
Sale Point: preCOVID: 80% DtoC, 19% restaurant, 1% hospital. Several counties in MI
Farm scales: mostly small and medium, maybe 1 large

Sale Point: Consumer: DtC sales and CSA Farm Sales

Mission: Economic implies a focus on improving the profitability and viability of local growers
Sale Point: Prvt: Institutions: Hospitals and other private, non-governmental instutions

Mission: Social impiles a focus on improvement the ability of lower income individuals to have access to freshly grown local foods
Sale Point: Pub Institutions: Schools, colleges, universities and other government instutions

Mission: Environmental implies a focus on sustainability and protection of general environment
Community implies a focus on growing inter-community relationships
Rankings
3: A primary focus of the food hbu
2: A secondary but recongized focus of the hub
1: A minor or consquential effect of the hub
0: Not considered
